question.text:
The nucleus is a significant organelle found in the cell. Read the following statements about the nucleus and select the option that correctly determines the number of false statements.

(i) The nuclear envelope consists of two parallel membranes having space between them called pericentriolar space.

(ii) The outer membrane of the nucleus usually remains continuous with the Golgi apparatus.

(iii) The nuclear matrix or the nucleoplasm contains nucleolus and chromatin.

(iv) Larger and more numerous nucleoli are present in cells actively carrying out lipid synthesis

solution.text: Nucleus first discovered by Brown found in eukaryotic cell has an envelope made of two parallel membranes. The space between membranes is called as pernuclear space. The outer membrane of the nucleus has been observed to run continuous with endoplasmic reticulum rather than Golgi bodies. Nucleolus and chromatin are found within the matrix of nucleus. Cells actively carrying out protein synthesis generally show larger and multiple nucleoli.
